articles.author: Jomy Jos Pullokaran
articles.title: Tata Steel Q4 results: Net profit slumps 84% to Rs 1,566 crore but beats estimates - CNBCTV18
articles.description: The slump was mainly due to falling demand in Europe and weak steel prices. Shares of Tata Steel Ltd ended at Rs 110.30, up by Rs 2.40, or 2.22 percent on the BSE.
articles.content: Tata Steel on Tuesday, May 2, reported an 84.1 percent year-on-year decline in consolidated net profit at Rs 1,566.2 crore for the fourth quarter that ended March 31, 2023, due to falling demand in E… [+481 chars]
